name: N-(3-chlorophenyl)-3,3,3-trifluoro-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4014
Reason: 3-Chlorophenyl and trifluoromethyl functional groups are known to increase the melting point of a molecule. The 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-propanamide base has a melting point of around 100°C, which is a reasonable estimate based on the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969. The 3-chlorophenyl group can increase the melting point by approximately +50°C due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The trifluoromethyl group can also increase the melting point by approximately +20°C due to the increased molecular weight and steric hindrance.
